           <dt>&#x015b;va&#x015b;ura </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;v&#x00e1;&#x015b;ura</em> m. (prob. for orig. <em>sva&#x015b;ura</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#below">below.</a>) a father-in-law, husband's or wife's father (in the oldest language commonly the former, in the S&#x016b;tras the latter, in Class. lang&#x1e6d;language both meanings </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also applied to a maternal uncle and to any venerable person) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; du. (cf. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-2, 72) a father and mother-in-law <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;">Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> (also pl., e.g. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> x, 95, 12 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> xiv, 2, 27 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (prob. <em>&#x012b;</em>), f. = <em>br&#x0101;hm&#x012b;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for <em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;r&#x016b;&#x0341;</em> below. [Cf. Gk. ? ; [1105, 3] Lat. <em>socer</em> ; Lith. <em>s&#x015b;&#x00e9;s&#x015b;uras</em> ; Slav. [svekru] ; Goth. <em>swaihra</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>swe&#x00f3;r</em> ; Germ. <em>swe10her</em>, <em>&#x1e63;chw&#x0101;0her</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; &#x015b;va&#x015b;uraka </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;uraka</em> m. a dear or poor father-in-law <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vet">Vet.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; &#x015b;va&#x015b;ur&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;ur&#x012b;ya</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. relating or belonging to a father-in-law <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r">&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; &#x015b;va&#x015b;urya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;urya</em> m. a brother-in-law, wife's or husband's brother (esp. 'a husband's younger brother') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; &#x015b;va&#x015b;r&#x016b; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;r&#x016b;&#x0341;</em> f. (of <em>&#x015b;va&#x015b;ura</em>) a mother-in-law (either the wife's or the husband's mother) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the mother-in-law and the other wives of the father-in-law <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> [Cf. Lat. <em>socrus</em> ; Slav. <em>svekry</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>swe10ger</em> ; Germ. <em>swigar</em>, <em>swiger</em>, <em>&#x1e63;chwieger</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; &#x015b;va&#x015b;r&#x016b;&#x015b;va&#x015b;ura </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;va&#x015b;ura</em> m. du. (cf. L.) or pl. (cf. Kath&#x0101;s.) mother and father-in-law, parents-in-law</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; &#x015b;va&#x015b;r&#x016b;snu&#x1e63;&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;snu&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em> f. du. mother-in-law and daughter-in-law <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-dhana-sa&#x1e43;v&#x0101;da</em> m. 'agreement in respect of the property of mother and daughter-in-law', N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x015b;vas 1</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x015b;vas</em> (cf. &#x221a;3 <em>-&#x015b;u&#x1e63;</em>), cl. 2. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 61) <em>&#x015b;vasiti</em> (Ved. and ep. also <em>&#x015b;v&#x00e1;sati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>&#x015b;vasih&#x00ed;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a>, <em>&#x015b;vasa</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; impf. <em>or aor.</em> <em>a&#x015b;vas&#x012b;t</em>, ep. also <em>a&#x015b;vasat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. or Prec. <em>&#x015b;vasy&#x0101;t</em>, ep. also <em>&#x015b;vaset</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pr. p. <em>&#x015b;vasat</em>, ep. also <em>&#x015b;vasam&#x0101;na</em> [for <em>&#x015b;vasam&#x0101;na</em>, below] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>&#x015b;a&#x015b;v&#x0101;sa</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>&#x015b;vasit&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x015b;vasi&#x1e63;yati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>&#x015b;vasitum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>-&#x015b;vasya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>), to blow, hiss, pant, snort <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to breathe, respire, draw breath (also = live) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to sigh, groan <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to strike, kill <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naigh">Naigh.</a> ii, 19: Caus. <em>&#x015b;v&#x0101;sayati</em> (aor. <em>a&#x015b;i&#x015b;vasat</em>), to cause to blow or breathe &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause heavy breathing <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a>: Desid. <em>&#x015b;i&#x015b;vasi&#x1e63;ati</em> Gr.: Intens. <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;&#x015b;vasyate</em>, <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;&#x015b;vasti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> (only p. <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;&#x015b;vasat</em>, snorting <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrS">MaitrS.</a>)</dd>
